content: http://i.usatoday.net/tech/graphics/iss_timeline/flash.htm Because they put a man on the Moon (1969), just a year after I graduated High School, I really thought my kids or grandkids would be vacationing there. If we had not spent so much money on this Planet designing ways to kill each other, where would we be by now?? - - Oh well - - Wandering and Wondering

content: quote: Originally posted by greywolfghost: http://i.usatoday.net/tech/graphics/iss_timeline/flash.htm Because they put a man on the Moon (1969), just a year after I graduated High School, I really thought my kids or grandkids would be vacationing there. If we had not spent so much money on this Planet designing ways to kill each other, where would we be by now?? - - Oh well - - You graduated in 69? You are still a young wolf pup GWG. By 1969 I had already served one tour in Europe, one tour in Vietnam, one tour in Korea and was in the middle of my second Vietnam tour. I remember hearing on AFRVietnam that Neil Armstrong had just walked on the moon. I remember looking up at the moon and thinking I hope he can remember how to get back! I don't believe that we would have been any better off than we are now if the Governments had not wasted our tax dollars. Where ever there are politicians then you know that our money is being wasted. The only wat to get ahead is to have term limits.

content: Old fart! But as I said, as a kid just out of high school (68) and one year of college under my belt (69), I really felt optimistic at seeing Armstrong on the Moon, but 4 of my friends had been killed in Viet Nam, and SDS wast starting to take over and burn campuses around the country - the world just seemed to be turning sour. I got angry and enlisted in the Army, and the World really hasn't gone anywhere worth going or done anything worth doing since that day... Just more hate and more greed and more power-mongering and more killing - 40 years we have been lost in the Wilderness of meagerness and smallness of purpose - - Wandering and Wondering
reply: Old fart! But as I said, as a kid just out of high school (68) and one year of college under my belt (69), I really felt optimistic at seeing Armstrong on the Moon, but 4 of my friends had been killed in Viet Nam, and SDS wast starting to take over and burn campuses around the country - the world just seemed to be turning sour. content: Yea, I guess that I am a member of the old farts club. The way things are looking now, there will not be enough money in the Federal coffers to do much about space travel until we repay China for the demorats loans for bailouts. The possibilities for achievment for this country are actually endless but we have to have a governemnt that can see the future and strive for the stars.
